snippet: A proposal that very large banks maintain 6 percent leverage ratios, twice the ratio that smaller banks are supposed to meet, has drawn the usual complaints.
abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column supports new proposal by American regulators to increase capital reserve requirements at large banks, saying it is essential risk-management tool despite usual complaints from bankers; holds that regulators are unlikely to back down from proposal, given lessons learned in wake of financial crisis.
lead_paragraph: A proposal that very large banks maintain 6 percent leverage ratios, twice the ratio that smaller banks are supposed to meet, has drawn the usual complaints.

headline.print_headline: Grumbles Follow Plan To Raise Bank Capital
headline.main: Grumbles Follow Plan to Raise Bank Capital
